items.title: 10.16km / 301m / 1h00m34s
items.content_html: I headed up to Saint Cyr and got started a little closer to the trailhead. A couple of kilometers to warm up and then onto the rocky trail up towards the Mont Thou. The ground was wet and heavy, with increasingly slippery mud on the way uphill. Closing in on the final push to Mont Thou it got to the point where there was no grip at all - time to change shoes? - and a barbed wire fence on the left hand side of the trail. Slip here and I could make a mess of things, so I found my way onto a parallel road and made the final few hundred meters a little bit easier. Turning around, it was all downhill - if muddy and a little too slippery for my liking - on the way home. Back through Saint Cyr, down to Saint Rambert, and finished things off at the supermarket because the wife needed soda.

items.title: 8.61km / 164m / 51m40s
items.content_html: After three days of some steady runs I headed out for some active recovery today. Lower speed but still quick turnover, and enjoying the foggy weather alongside the Saône. I made a downhill detour through the Forét de la Rochette and it was pretty, if a little slippery. The final push home was steady and slightly faster but I managed a 6:00 pace for the run overall, just as intended.

items.title: 10.02km / 132m / 55m51s
items.content_html: Back to work this morning and after dropping the boys at school and knocking out revisions to a white paper for a client, I was off for some exercise at lunch. I ran down along the river to Collonges, up the hill a little, and then back via Saint Rambert to home. I threw in a little detour near the end as I was feeling OK, but didn’t push things too hard. All good.

items.title: 9.64km / 190m / 54m45s
items.content_html: A day spent looking after the two boys while the wife worked. The kids were good - easy day, really - and though it was raining when I left I was looking forward to closing the day with a run. I headed up to Fourviere hoping to see the light show but, alas, it’s over. No big deal, I kept it even and enjoyed the night time rain run. Back to work tomorrow…

items.content_html: Rain all afternoon but a run all the same. I headed straight up the hill, headed towards Saint Fortunat and then turned for Mont Thou. items.title: 10.27km / 168m / 55m16s
items.content_html: Sub-zero temperatures all day and I headed out for a Sunday night run anyway. I didn’t go with the jacket which was likely a mistake judging by how red I was when I returned, but the run was fun. Down to Vernay, up the hill with a new PB, back down to the Ile Barbe, through the park for a bit of climbing and then home again. A quick 10K considering the steepness of the two hills but all good, cold fun.

items.content_html: A couple of sick kids and a full day of work combined for a less-than-ideal preparation for a night run. I didn’t really eat a good lunch and lacked energy from the outset but managed some climbing and a little bit of trail running. Not bad and not another soul about running on the first night of the Fête des Lumières.

items.title: 17.02km / 208m / 1h30m23s
items.content_html: The wife took care of the school run this morning and so I was able to head out for something a little longer than I normally might find the time for on a weekday morning. Started off with the flat path down to the Ile Barbe, then back through town until I got to Perrache and the hill up to Fourviere. Snapped a couple of pictures at the top, then down to Valmy, along the river, a quick stop at the supermarket and home. Nice one.

items.title: 4.35km / 71m / 25m35s
items.content_html: A very quick run back home from dropping one kid at school to see the other kid in bed. I also had to stop at the bakery to grab some bread, too, so the last section wasn’t nearly as hard as it could have been. Still: time on feet, right? I gave it a bit of a kick across the bridge and managed a steady time there, but in the cold and the fog I didn’t spend much time outside. Oh, well, I’ll wait for Thursday night.

items.title: 7.08km / 357m / 46m15s
items.content_html: After a weekend with the flu and some real soreness in my joints, I dropped the boys at school and hit the hill next door. Someone had nabbed my Strava Local Legend badge so I did a couple of up-and-backs to nab it back. A fast descent and then over the river to Collonges to nab back another Local Legend and then a bus ride home.

items.title: Fifteen 50K's Since 2015
items.content_html:
• Fastest: 3:55 (flat, running for time)
  • Slowest: 7:13 (hilly, muddy, trails, night)
  • Average: 5:16

The 15 efforts fit into what I think of as six broad ‘bands’:

  • Sprint: 1 - 3:55
  • Strong: 6 - 4:24, 4:26, 4:33, 4:41, 4:47, 4:47
  • Solid: 3 - 5:04, 5:05, 5:11
  • OK: 1 - 5:34
  • Slow: 3 - 6:29, 6:31, 6:32
  • Very Slow: 1 - 7:13

Honestly, if I could run a 50K now in 5 hours I would be happy. Sneaking in under 5 hours would be a great result moving into 2023, especially if unsupported/outside of a race.

items.title: 9.02km / 197m / 52m56s
items.content_html: After a morning spent on the business and working with a client on some content strategy for 2023, I used my lunch break to do a quick out-and-back. I went up the hill to Saint Cyr being careful not to push into the red zone, and when I had done about four-and-a-half kilometers, I turned for home. Nothing too hard, nothing too fast, and a good use of the lunch break.

items.title: 9.63km / 165m / 55m44s
items.content_html: It was raining when I started my run at the school and raining when it ended, too. In the middle? More rain. I didn’t run fast and it didn’t get too cold, though it did mean I didn’t get a whole lot of data from the touchscreen Apple Watch which doesn’t like water between the screen and the finger. A good way to start the week, if a strange slow finish as I had to pick up a package for the wife at the bottom of the hill and hike it home.

items.title: 6.47km / 125m / 37m00s
items.content_html: After a day looking after the kid and wandering the city from playground to playground, I went out to run a quick 6K. Nothing special, nothing fast - just wanted to keep the weekly mileage above 60K again. A couple of short hills but took them at a power hike, and though it was getting dark and cooling down, I had fun.

items.title: 21.20km / 261m / 1h56m27s
items.content_html: Not a good day for the business with a major client dialing things way back for 2023. With a lot to think about I headed out for a longer run with a 20K in mind. Kept it all nice and steady, and enjoyed the trail by the Rhône, and even took in a flight of stairs for good measure. A bit of quick thinking nearing the end and I managed to tick off the half marathon distance. A win of sorts, I guess.

items.title: 7.60km / 133m / 42m08s
items.content_html: I skipped the morning run after dropping the boys at school and instead headed back to work. The morning done, I headed into a client’s office in the city with the goal to run home - and I did. A 7.5K effort with a hill in the opening kilometers and a pleasant descent off the Croix Rousse. The backpack was neither light or perfect for the task, but I made it.

items.title: 10.11km / 247m / 58m22s
items.content_html: A run I had been playing with in my mind for a few weeks now. I had thought about running up over the hill at Caluire, down to the Rhone behind the Parc, and then back over the hill again on a different route to cross the bridge at the Ile Barbe. It all went to plan and even if the hills were a little steep, it was good fun and measured out at more or less exactly 10K.

items.title: 7.59km / 219m / 44m05s
items.content_html: OK, I admit it: Strava and its Local Legend badge sucked me into this run. After dropping the bots at school I headed to Collonges where I needed four ascents of the Côte de la Chaux to be the new ‘Local Legend’ of the hill. So I did that - four times up and down - and then headed for home. It’s not wrong, right?

items.title: 8.28km / 300m / 54m11s
items.content_html: Dropped the boys off at school and then headed out for a run. I wanted to just get in 45 minutes to an hour and wasn’t aiming to do any real climbing, but Mont Cindre was just so close! I headed across the bridge to Collonges, through the village and then up via the trails to the summit. The descent on the stairs is always a pain but the final run home was easy. I picked it up a little on the final flat to Jean Perrin but didn’t hold it to home. After all, it’s a Monday, right?

items.title: 16.33km / 733m / 1h55m28s
items.content_html: A night time run on the hills of the Mont d’Or. Started off in Couzon and then headed uphill for a fe hundred meters of vertical gain before descending back down to Saint Romain. The long climb to Mont Thou was next, then a descent before the final summit at Mont Cindre. The final long downhill to home wasn’t fast but it was steady. A nice longer run.

items.content_html: Only managed four hours sleep and the wife handed the kid to me at 5am when he woke so I wasn’t going to get anymore. This made the run a recovery effort more than anything else. Not hard, hiked the up hills, took a couple of photos and kept the downhills fairly smooth and not too fast. Bring on the weekend!

items.content_html: A day of meetings, workshops, and a client dinner meant I didn’t have a lot of time to fit in a run - or at least not a long one. I decided to go for speed over distance and get back home from the school drop-off fast. It was only 22-ish minutes but worth it to get the legs turning over before a day that will be spent mostly sitting down.

items.title: 12.03km / 444m / 1h16m11s
items.content_html: Started out in Couzon in the fog and headed straight up an old cycling route that I know. At the top of the climb I hit the trails and made my way up to Mont Thou. The higher I got, the muddier the trails got and while I didn’t slip over, it was moving underfoot for the last 15 minutes of the climb. A photo at the top and then a quick descent to Saint Cyr with a couple of muddy sections. The final three kilometers home were smooth and the legs turned over nicely before I jumped into a warm shower and work.

items.title: 11.17km / 303m / 1h07m58s
items.content_html: Wasn’t feeling amazing when I set out for the run after dropping the kid at school and so my mind was set on a recovery run. It’s 4km back to home directly so a few laps of the track at Collonges and a roundabout way back and I should be able to do a half hour or 45 minutes of flat-ish roads. A quick toilet break at the Collonges track, though, and I felt better and so I decided to close out the Strava Climbing Challenge for the month with the final 259m I needed. It ended up being a touch over 300m of climbing and I came back a little muddy but a lot happier.

items.title: 12.03km / 408m / 1h14m45s
items.content_html: Took a little longer getting back from the morning school run this morning and enjoyed a little time in the hills. I did a quick uphill to Caluire from the Saone, then ran the downhill to Fontaines on the Montee Roy. Across the river to our new place and then up the hill on the trails to Mont Cindre. I caught my breath and then made the descent through Saint Cyr to Saint Rambert to close it out.

items.title: 11.78km / 14m / 59m34s
items.content_html: An afternoon run before a long writing session on my last day in Leipzig. I wanted to head into the forest on the southern edge of the city after my experience on the trails on the western edge of the city on Monday morning. The trails were nice and soft, shady and lots of leaves on the ground, and so close to the city center.

items.title: 5.45km / 28m / 34m17s
items.content_html: The BIO Europe team organized a running tour of the city center of Leipzig and so I signed up for a morning on my feet. The pace wasn’t high so I got to talk to others the whole time which made for a change from running alone. Lots to see, some interesting historical tidbits were shared by the guide, and I finished it off with a quick sprint back to the hotel to get the work day started.

items.content_html: Up early in Leipzig ahead of a full day of meetings and briefings. Had the notion of exploring the city a little pre-dawn and managed a 10K loop through the streets and parks of the city. Some very slippery cobbles and a little mud in the park but clean air and a great way to start the day.

items.title: 10.35km / 378m / 58m46s
items.content_html: The monthly climbing challenge on Strava is to hit 2000 meters of vertical gain. As I’m soon to be away in a rather flat city for a week, I thought I’d bag the last 325 meters I needed tonight to be safe. Hill repeats close to home and a nice loop on safe roads make for a convenient evening session before a good night’s sleep.

items.title: 6.43km / 225m / 38m03s
items.content_html: As I was not doing the school run this morning I set out to run a couple of uphill repeats instead. Val Rosay is quiet in the morning and so I did what turned out to be about a one-mile loop including 500m of uphill and a twisting downhill back to the bottom of the climb. Good clean fun and a great start to the day.

items.title: 5.51km / 107m / 30m58s
items.content_html: First run back after a week out with COVID. Didn’t feel amazing at any point but didn’t feel all that bad, either. Walked the two main uphills (stairs and approach to Collonges center; stairs and approach to Saint Rambert) but didn’t lose all that much pace. Some good leg turnover on the final 1500m from the Plateau back home. Will go a little further tomorrow, see if the feeling continues to come back.

[The White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/07/06/remarks-by-president-biden-on-the-american-rescue-plans-special-financial-assistance-program/)
